courses.title: When to use relativsatze
courses.description: In this course you will learn how to use the relative clauses in German. Relative clauses are used to link sentences together and to form more complex sentences. They are introduced by relative pronouns such as der, die, das, welcher, welche, welches, was, and more.

courses.title: When to use Das Perfekt
courses.description: German usually uses the present perfect tense (das Perfekt) to talk about past events, as in English. The present perfect tense refers to an action that took place at some time in the past and is still ongoing.

courses.title: How to use the Akkusativ and Dativ
courses.description: German use the accusative case to indicate the direct object of a sentence. The direct object is the person or thing that receives the action expressed by the verb. The accusative case is also used after certain prepositions, such as durch, f√ºr, gegen, ohne, um, and wider.

courses.title: Modal Verbs
courses.description: To make a sentence negative in German you usually use the word nicht. However, when you use a modal verb, the word nicht is placed after the modal verb and not at the end of the sentence.

courses.title: Question Words
courses.description: Do you know how to ask questions in German? In this course you will learn how to use the question words in German. The question words are used to ask questions such as what, where, when, why, and how. They are also called interrogative pronouns.

courses.title: Subordinating Conjunctions
courses.description: The subordinating conjunctions are used to join a subordinate clause to a main clause. The subordinate clause is dependent on the main clause and cannot make sense on its own. The subordinating conjunctions are used to join a subordinate clause to a main clause. The subordinate clause is dependent on the main clause and cannot make sense on its own.

courses.title: Coordinating Conjunctions

courses.title: Introduction to Adverbs

courses.title: Types of Adverbs
courses.description: Adverbs are divided into different categories depending on what they describe. Adverbs of manner describe how something happens.
